message:
Hi my customer is nervous about /admin being available on a deployed site even 
though we are running under https My solution is remmove the /admin URL and do a
 separate "admin" site running off a different domain.
Other suggestion including obscuring the admin the admin url e.g /mynewadmin or 
only allowing the admin url only 
if the request comes for a designated IP.
So what is the django best practice as regardss /admin in production sites?
I restrict by IP in the webserver config (nginx or apache)
Place it at a non-standard URL and lock it down by IP (I've used a middleware in the past to handle this with the INTERNAL_IPS setting: http://djangosnippets.org/snippets/2095/ )
my problem is the smaller customers may have dynamic IPs
I've generally gone for a separate domain and access via VPN
i think i'm following @garethr,  and go with a separate  site
